infoDrawer.title: About the Module Editor
infoDrawer.description: Manage global system modules that can be used across different verticals. Define features, configurations, and dependencies between modules.
infoDrawer.whatAreModulesPoint1: Reusable functional blocks that integrate into different business verticals.
infoDrawer.whatAreModulesPoint2: Each module has specific configurations that determine its behavior.
infoDrawer.whatAreModulesPoint3: Modules can have dependencies with other modules to function correctly.
infoDrawer.whatAreModulesPoint4: They can be activated or deactivated according to the contracted plan or tenant needs.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint1: Create, edit, and delete system modules.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint2: Organize modules by verticals and categories.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint3: Define configuration schemas with type validation.
infoDrawer.administrationPoint4: Establish dependencies between modules to ensure correct operation.
infoDrawer.relationshipsPoint1: Dependencies ensure that all necessary modules are activated.
infoDrawer.relationshipsPoint2: The system automatically applies these restrictions when assigning modules to plans or tenants.
infoDrawer.relationshipsPoint3: When deactivating a module, the system verifies that it doesn't break dependencies of other modules.
infoDrawer.relationshipsPoint4: Relationships between modules can be visualized to better understand the system architecture.

configuration_schema_description: The configuration schema defines the structure of settings for this module.
dependencies_description: Dependencies determine which other modules must be enabled for this module to function.

dependencies_explanation: When a module has dependencies, those modules must be enabled for this module to function. If you add dependencies, the system will automatically enforce this relationship when assigning modules to plans or tenants.
